France has a military?  Napoleon's back?

> [{quoted}](name=6Sfool,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=UJofEmAt,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-03-27T19:45:11.549+0000)
>
> France has a military?  Napoleon's back?

They do, they back off the moment the enemy cocks a gun.
After learning about Napoleon and the Reign of Terror I was always confused on how the French got their cowardly reputation.

Throughout the history of france and the creation of france, they were actually pretty intense and were almost eager to fight it seemed, and they won a ton too...

But them being cowards makes for better memes, so that's what people enjoy thinking.
They got the reputation for being cowards after they ended up surrendering in world war 2 i believe?

> [{quoted}](name=Rman127,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=UJofEmAt,comment-id=00020000000000000000,timestamp=2017-03-27T23:54:21.621+0000)
>
> They got the reputation for being cowards after they ended up surrendering in world war 2 i believe?

I thought that was Russia? Especially since parts of the French military kept on fighting(at least until they got evacuated along with the British.)

Germany never even reached the Russian capital, they got destroyed in a winter invasion into Russia. The French leadership surrendered to a smaller German army after only putting up a 6 week long fight, which is why they get the reputation for cowardice.

And even then, that was only because they realized they were going to lose anyways, since Germans were actually a much stronger force.  10 people vs one sounds pretty easy win, until that one guy is in a tank.
But the WWII propaganda going on would indeed make it seem like any incident of surrendering to the Germans was a prime example of cowardice, since the stigma all around the world was to fight them no matter what.  Not the French's fault they valued their soldiers lives before they lost the battle.
Thx.
I see, quick question, smaller army in comparison to the German invasion of Russia, or is it in comparison to France's army?
pretty sure its a yes to both

> [{quoted}](name=reaperteaser,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=UJofEmAt,comment-id=000200000000000000000000000000010000,timestamp=2017-03-28T00:28:00.460+0000)
>
> pretty sure its a yes to both

I see, thanks.

I think this applies to Fiora regardless of whether she's fed or not...

No shit I curb stomped her all game then like 20 minutes in she just destroys me. Is she one of those champs that puts the game on a timer or just very good with items?
She was just designed to always have the potential to win a duel no matter how behind she is.  She also happens to crap on tanks after getting an item or two.
